Reviews.Content: Heaven of Ubud       View of valley from pool after shower of rain
Reviews.Author: Kenryuu

Reviews.Content: Wow... just Wow I have traveled the world.. and have stayed in many hotels.. this place is nothing less than amazing. Each Villa has it's own infinity pool looking out over their beautiful valley. Everything is stond carved and the staff is incredibly attentitve. The rooms are immaculate and ultra cozy. The food at the restaurant is satisfying... and the nearby town is fun to explore
Reviews.Author: RicoDiver

Reviews.Content: Wonderful stay My stay at the restaurant was above all expectations. Service was great, always with a smile. So for me it awsn't like some before me mentioned that service could be better. I was told the hotel finds it important to create jobs for the locals, educating them and making sure they get proper income. Maybe therefore they are less experienced and still learning. Anyway good bed, traditional furniture and nice artwork there. The stones are carved out beautifully. Rooms are tidied nicely when you get back from dinner and decorated with flowers. whith that weather it's great to take a plunge in the wonderful private pool with the serene background sound of the waterfall and nature surrounding you. I don't agree with the reviews before that interior is kitsch in a negative way - it is real Balinese and that what's makes it so different from other hotels where you alsmost forget that you're in bali and not inany other modern city. What I wasn't too keen on was the roof, which looks stunning but you''ll sometimes find some dust (whats the english word) of it on the sheets. Also the bath tub is not that handy if you want to take a quick shower and need to close all curtains around you if you want to make sure youre having a private bath. There's no bathroom door to close so it's more suited for honeymoon or than friends travelling. What i'm also missing is the bidet or toilet shower you find everywhere in indonesia. Hope they will work on that. But still, what a great place. The paronamic view from the upper restaurant is so stunning. The hotel has 2 restaurants underneath the upper one which all serve the same food although seem to be themed differently. The view there is still fantastic but not as great as on top. Near the river is another restaurant which serves different food, all organic. The plot of land where the veggies are grown can be seen lays right next to the river so you can see people farming from the restaurants! Taste was ok and again you're seated so peacefully near the river. Only thing is you need to walk all the way down which is a real bummer. I'm in good shape but with the indonesian weather it's no fun doing. You can also take the shuttle and eat in the centre of ubud. The shuttle bus goes regularly so no problem doing that. Would definately recommend a stay here for some nights.
Reviews.Author: QWelsh

Reviews.Content: Great place with authentic Bali feel We stayed in July 2008 for 5 nights and loved it. The hotel as stated in the other reviews here is located right in the jungle and by the Ayung river. The scenery from the villas (all the rooms are villas with pools). and the main lobby are breathtaking. The architecture of the hotel, the villas are done in a traditional Bali style that makes you feel like you're really in Bali (unlike some other hotels). The villas themselves are big. The ones we stayed at had a bedroom, dinining area, bathroom with a gigantic tub (enough to have couple of adults in there )and a huge pool that you can actually swim and do laps (unlike some other pool at other villas of other hotels). The staff was always friendly and most spoke decent English and was very accomodating. The hotel picked us up from the airport and returned us there for free, they also have free shuttles to the Ubud town center so you can shop and dine there (try the Dirty Duck, Lotus Cafe for eats). They also arranged a personalized tour of the surrounding area for us (this was charged but inexpensive). The only downsides would be: 1) There's no internet in the villas (although they have free wireless in the main lobby and one computer in the business center you can use for free for the internet). 2) The villas themselves have a limited hot water, and if you fill the huge tub up with water, you may have to wait a little to get hot water at the shower...3) Since the hotel is located in the middle of the jungle, there are lots of bugs including mosquitoes. And although the Bali architecture is beautiful, it meas there are some space between the doors for the bugs to get through. They do have a bug screen aroung the bed, but I suggest bringing bug spray as well.But overall, I would definelt stay here again for the room and the service you get here for the price.
Reviews.Author: Tokyodude

Reviews.Content: Absolutely stunning       the lagoon pool
Reviews.Author: shooxou

Reviews.Content: Stunning location, but could be so much better... We stayed 3 nights at the Royal Pita Maha during our 3rd visit to Bali and Ubud. Overall the resort is stunning in terms of rchitecture and landscaping: the moment you enter the resort you're overwhelmed by the detailed architecture, and the views on the Ayung valey from the restaurants. Stairs and elevators bring you all the way down to the river, a true sanctuary, but not much to do there beyond the spa and laguna pool. Our villa was extremely nice: spacious, large bathroom, large sized outdoor pool and 2 deck chairs. On the minus side, we had the impression that the hotel was struggling with food quality. We only had breakfast in the hotel, but it said enough: fruit juice was either not fresh or thinned with water, fruit served was not ripe, bakery was rather industrial than home made, etc... Service was OK but not up to standard of any other $350 the room resort. Because of the rain, we asked for check out 1 day earlier, which was no problem. Overall the hotel is impressive but we sensed a lack of atmosphere and a final touch that was missing. Especially the food quality was not up to standard.
Reviews.Author: AlainAntwerp

Reviews.Content: Astonishing Setting We spent 5 nights and loved every moment. The setting overlooking the Ayung river is National Geographic stunning. We were in villa 138 high above the sheer cliff over the river bottom--no other part of the resort was visible as we looked across the gorge to the jungled far side. Birds flew by in the morning and in the evening the beneficial bats entertained. Though only 5 years old, the resort is built in the style of a Balinese temple and appears to be much older--we felt as if we were walking through an ancient palace. Serenity is the overall feeling. Staff extremely helpful and friendly. When the laptop ran poorly via the converter we brought the hotel furnished an industrial strength one and the problem was solved. Food was beautifully prepared and delicious. The spa is located beside the river and was a fabulous experience. Yoga in the open air pavillion by the side of the river. A natural/organic restaurant is located by the river adjacent to the spa and yoga area----wonderful healthy food! Regular no cost shuttle service is provided into central Ubud throughout the day and evening making a car unnecessary. A completely enjoyable experience.
Reviews.Author: gone2tahoe

Reviews.Content: Agree with previous reviewers - potential to be so much more...       villa
Reviews.Author: GlobalVenturer

Reviews.Content: Stunning view, Friendly staff, beautiful rooms       The whole lagoon is about 3, 4 times longer than pictured here.
Reviews.Author: lcacds

Reviews.Content: Mixed Feelings as Well I just returned from 4 nights here and I agree totally with the previous review (Knaz, Madrid). The facility might be the most beautiful I have seen especially the landscaping, facility and location. It has a lower area by the river that is extremely beautiful and serine. What is lacking is is food quality and basic hotel operations from housekeeping, to funishings (except the bed) to ants all over the floor because they have never installed doors that seal them out. The pools are beautiful but steps to get into them would help. They are a small operation and do not have professional management. Also two staff complained that the hotel does not share the 10% service charge we all pay. In spite of all this, its so beautiful, I would recomend for a few days.
Reviews.Author: MrBill_89509

Reviews.Content: Mixed feelings about the RPM We spent 4 nights at the Royal Pita Maha and I can still feel how my heart stopped beating for a long long second when we entered the hotel and were stunned by views from the veranda. The landscape and views are to truly die for and the pools are everything to write home about. There was lots of privacy and space between the villas. The staff was absolutely wonderful and nothing was too much trouble. The bed was comfy and enormous and so was the bathroom. Everything outdoor was extremely well kept - I would have gladly rented the room just for the terrace and pool. Having said that, do not expect the real 5-star experience with all the extras and fine details. I was following the latest TA reviews before my trip and I really really wanted to disagree with a previous poster鈥檚 comments on kitsch, but kitsch it was. The place is in serious need of a d茅cor facelift and, at those prices, it should really consider replacing the scruffy towels. The sitting room is uncomfortable and uninviting; I doubt many people use that space. There is a serious bug issue although I personally didn鈥檛 have a problem with that - part and parcel of the luxury jungle experience I guess. Do not expect a proper turndown service, after struggling (with no luck) to get the mosquito net tucked into position the first night I had to ask them for a turndown service (and remind them every night). But I think what annoyed me most was the processed pineapple juice 鈥?a hotel that charges these prices should be able to come up with freshly squeezed pineapple juice 鈥?it鈥檚 so readily available all over Bali and I鈥檝e stayed at many cheaper and cheap hotels where fresh juice was the norm. Overall, I鈥檓 glad I went because those memories of sitting by the pool in awe and listening to the birds sing away and the river flow in the background are mine to keep forever. If you can afford a night or two in this life go for it, but try to get the best rate possible.
Reviews.Author: knaz

Reviews.Content: Breathtaking view and lovely gardens       View from my room
Reviews.Author: MaryMerry

Reviews.Content: Excellent Service, Beautiful Hotel This place is a safe and beautiful santuary. You will feel completely cut off from the rest of the world and never want to leave the resort. However if you do, there is a shuttle every hour and they are very accomodating in terms of where you want to be dropped off, picked up. Everything about the Royal is beautiful, from every blade of grass to every pebble on the ground. The size of the pool in every villa is unbelievable. The view from our villa was so gorgeous that we would just sit there spellbound every morning. Be prepared to have a 2 hour breakfast every morining cause the views are so awesome that you'll not want to rush. Service is excellent, there is nothing that they won't do for you. The worst thing was having to leave. I also tried out the kirana spa which is beautifully designed and has fantastic facilities. The spring water pools are lovely and the wellness and healing centre does exactly that, gives you wellness and heals... Lovely place. Can't wait to go back.
Reviews.Author: hookedonholidaysKL

Reviews.Content: Not fantastic but ok for luxury travellers       Swimming in large villa pool
Reviews.Author: viptraveller

Reviews.Content: Treated like Royalty!       View from pool
Reviews.Author: akboxak

Reviews.Content: The most pristine, perfect resort in Indonesia the greatest resort in Ubud, if not in Bali. Owned, operated and built over 5+ years by the Balinese Royal Family, and every detail perfectly crafted. I read the comments on this site before booking, and I found it ideal, perfect. What a wonderful stay.Do not stay here if you are not open to simple excercise or are not of decent health, as there are stairs as mentioend before. If you play sports, golf or anything of the sort, dont worry. SUPREME SPIRITUAL PARADISE. Dont miss this place.
Reviews.Author: BHinAUS

Reviews.Content: Understated Style We booked the Royal after alot of research on hotels in Ubud. We had previously stayed at the Pita Maha which we enjoyed and is part of the same group (owned by the Royal family of Ubud ) but the Royal got our business as it had a proper pool (not a plunge pool like some places) in the private villas. And what a treat it was. Our Villa was perched high above the valley and had views across to distant vocanos .Very morning we opened the curtains and just gazed out in wonder, and this was from our bed!!! The room was quite large and well appointed with a seperate lounge , which we felt was a waste as we never used it and bathroon on the other side with a sunken bath and separate shower.Yes there are quite a few stairs but there are elevators that take you down to the river below.The hotel was beautifully designed and the gardens outstanding. Handcrafted stone work everywhere. Athough we were told the hotel was 80% occupied you hardly saw anyone else it was so quite , peaceful and very relaxing. The staff were very attentive and helpful and you could tell had great pride in the hotel which shone through in their `service.The only down side was it is quite a way from Ubud ( about 15min drive) and shuttles go very hour, but they were prepared to pick you up from where ever you were in Ubud which was great at night. Also the food at the Hotel was very limited and very expensive ( All prices in $US dollars) which was disappointing, but this made you get out and try some of Ubuds great resturaunts like Indus, Cafe Luna, and Mosaic. We would recommend this hotel as a relaxing getway and the location is to die for!!!
Reviews.Author: HellsBellsPerth

Reviews.Content: The Ultimate !!!!!! My husband and I stayed here in a pool villa for our babymoon (last holiday before baby arrives !!!) I could not speak any more highly of this place, just stunning and perfect in every way. It does have quite a few steps so not reccomended for old of unfit people, although i was 6 months pregnant and coped fine. Food was delicous and reasonably priced and staff equisitly polite. The perfect place for solitude and relaxation - highly reccomend it !!!
Reviews.Author: babymooners

Reviews.Content: honeymoon We stayed at the Royal Pita Maha for part of our honeymoon in August. We were taken with the view from the start. It is a remarkable place and the view will astound you. The service was good, very friendly staff but their English was only okay.Our room was amazing. A pool villa with a fantastic view. My husband saw a monkey by our pool one morning. The rooms are very big and we loved this hotel.The only drawback were the bugs. We asked for a mosquito net and that helped. As their are two large cracks between the door so many bugs can get in.THe problem we had was that I woke up one morning with bites on my face and then on my stomach. Turned out to be little red ants that bit me. So we left.But if that hadn't happened we would have stayed in this beautiful place. The scenery is amazing. The shuttle service is really good. They take you into Ubud and pick you up and are very accomodating.The breakfast is also very good. When we were there they were training their staff in yoga. I am sure when the place is running in full it will be quite amazing.We enjoyed the free internet access.The hotel is very ornate and quite something to look at. It is breathtaking and unimaginable. It is a great place. They should just do something about the gap in the door and the red ants.I recommend it just to look at the place. It will astound you.
Reviews.Author: torontofriend

Reviews.Content: Really Fantastic Villa! I really loved staying at the Pool Villa of Royal Pita Maha for 4 days, and I'd like to recommend this hotel to people who want to experience the harmony of the great view of tropical forests, luxury, art, and peace. The facility in villa was fully satisfiable with a large private pool with a great view - perhaps the largest and the best view among other hotels' villa's private pool with similiar price range. Spending an hour at the pool in the moonlight or even in the rain, and then plunging into the hottub in the bathroom made me feel really relaxed and heavenly.In the morning I could see fogs flow along the Ayung River gorge, and the breakfast at the restaurant couldn't be better. It was not a buffet-type, but served course by course. The restaurant also had a great view, the food was that of a 5-star class, and the atmosphere was marvellous. There are many stairs up and down, so it may be a little problem for someone but was not for me. Rather I enjoyed it because the paths are beautifully decorated. As for the mosquito, my family never got a bite at Royal. I was also worried about it when I read the review below, so at the check-in time, I asked the staff to set up the mosqutto net, and before going to bed, I sprayed the mosquito repellent. (The mosquito spray is equipped in the villa) The mosquitto net is also very romantic, which hung high on the ceilling, and my son loved it.Overall, the hotel itself is an art, and I never thought it was expensive. Royal Pita Maha is very good value for money, I think. I will definitely go back.
Reviews.Author: yrson1004

Reviews.Content: Room... Sorry! Villa... with a dream view...
Reviews.Author: French

Reviews.Content: Wait a minute.... Went to the Royal Pita Maha based on the reviews here. I must say I was NOT impressed.1.) YES - The views are magnificent2.) YES - The pool is huge3.) YES - the staff tries hard to please youBUTThe food is horrible, the menu is the same at all the restaurants in the hotel and gets boring very quickly. The selection is horrible and the indonesian food at the restaurants is barely passable. For a place where you would want to go and spend some time relaxing in your villa this becomes a real problem.Secondly, there isn't a spa.Again a problem. There is a spa next door called kirana, but different owner and the staff will not tell you about it.Lastly, the place is very disorganized, the same question is asked a dozen times. What time will you have dinner, when do you want to go to ubud. And when you do answer it it goes no where. (No dinner reservation, 30 minute wait for a car, etc.)I really cannot recommend this place until they get the bugs worked out.. Speaking of bugs. I got 50 mosquito bites in 5 days and my wife over 90. No joke. The rooms are not properly sealed and there isn't a mosquito net. On another note - Mozaic is simply out of this world. Reserve early and enjoy it.
Reviews.Author: tokyobali

Reviews.Content: By Far The Best View in Ubud...I Loved This Place!!!!!!       Side view of the bedroom
Reviews.Author: jbohun

Reviews.Content: Heavenly!       Natural Spring Pool
Reviews.Author: RebInSF

Reviews.Content: Royal Pita Maha - Heaven on Earth This resort is a dream. Absolute luxury that makes you want to stay there forever. The staff are unbelievably polite and friendly and the slightest request is always immediately met. We were there for our honeymoon recently and were staying for 3 nights in Ubud. A hotel private car picked us up from the Nusa Dua Beach Hotel and Spa and took us for an hour and a half drive to the Royal Pita Maha Resort. The drive through lots of deserted and poor areas worried us at first but then we went through a long winding road to the Royal Pita Maha resort and it was wonderful to get that first view of it. It's owned by Ubud's royal family and is completely secluded. Each cabin is huge (with a king size bed and a huge marble bathroom with a sunken spa bath) and has its own private pool surrounded by wonderfully lush scenery. Complete seclusion for those who are after peace and quiet.When we first arrived there was no DVD player in the room and we rang reception to enquire whether it was possible to have one. Within 20 minutes there were 3 workers at our door with a brand new DVD player ready to be installed.The hotel assigned a private driver to us whenever we wanted to go shopping in Ubud and that went a long way in making us feel comfortable. I would absolutely recommend this hotel to anyone who is thinking of going to Ubud. It is the one place that I can't wait to get back to in Bali.Heaven on earth.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Very nice               More photos
Reviews.Author: travelpro77

Reviews.Content: Wonderful service, incredible views We stayed at the Royal Pita Maha in Ubud, which is a fairly new hotel, just last week. It's far from the madding crowd and the views are spectacular. The resort is large, which meant walking around to view the river and sacred pool was almost like a nature ramble. The swimming pool in our villa was huge, with magnificent views of the greenery in the hills beyond, the same view which greeted us from our huge bed every morning. The villa was large, with three separate areas for the bedroom, lounge and bathroom (with a huge sunken bath). It was also clean and nicely decorated. We'd just come from the Grand Hyatt and the service at the Royal Pita Maya was far superior. The staff appeared genuinely friendly, helpful and attentive. It was truly excellent service with many smiles. I'd recommend this resort highly.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
